title: Exploring the Invisible Infrastructure of Search and Chatbots
content: Our guest contributor participated in a so-called Re:search Workshop where they explored the invisible infrastructure of the web focuing on search and chatbots and compared and discussed results coming out fra searching and prompting them side by side. By Kevin Klyssing Jensen Google has gone from being a noun to a verb. If we want to look something up, most people ‘google it’ without a second thought. This is what researcher Renée Ridgway terms ‘ubiquitous googling’ and it’s become an unconscio...
creator: Guest Contributor

title: Tools to Become Digitally Sovereign
content: Since 2016, DataEthics.eu has kept a list of alternative tools to Big Tech’s. In 2025, digital sovereignity has become a necessity, and therefore we encourage everybody to dive into the list and start the process of getting control of your own data and help the European tech industry grow. How to get started? Start with the easy ones. Change browser. Search engine. Translator. Chatbot. There are great alternatives to all of them. If you need more info or want to book a talk or workshop, do...
creator: Pernille Tranberg

title: New Open Source-Based Platform Can Disrupt Big Tech’s Grip on Danish Schools
content: Photo: publiccode.eu Open source tools in schools and municipalities will not only save society money and employ more people, they are also a significant step towards digital sovereignty. A new platform is ready to be developed and implemented. A group of open source promoters have developed the concept behind a new school platform, OS2 Skole , which is completely free of dependence on Big Tech. This new open source-based platform will not only protect kids’ data, it will also promote digi...
creator: Pernille Tranberg

title: Episode 4: Open Source Can Disrupt Big Tech’s Grip on The Public Sector
content: Indlægget Episode 4: Open Source Can Disrupt Big Tech’s Grip on The Public Sector blev vist første gang den Dataetisk Tænkehandletank .
creator: Pernille Tranberg
